metadata.title: Week 1 Day 3: Introduction to Latin Nouns

prior_knowledge_digest: Students should have a basic understanding of Latin pronunciation and the alphabet. They should be familiar with the concept of nouns in English, including their function as people, places, things, or ideas. Previous lessons introduced simple Latin greetings and common classroom phrases, setting the stage for more structured language learning.
yesterday_recap: Yesterday, we explored basic Latin greetings and classroom phrases, focusing on pronunciation and usage in simple dialogues.

primary: Identify and classify Latin nouns by gender

lesson_flow.description: Review basic Latin greetings and classroom phrases.
lesson_flow.student_action: Students will repeat phrases and answer questions about their meanings.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the concept of Latin nouns and their genders.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and take notes on noun classifications.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Explain the importance of gender in Latin nouns.

lesson_flow.description: Practice identifying noun genders using flashcards.
lesson_flow.student_action: Sort flashcards into masculine, feminine, and neuter categories.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Provide immediate feedback and correct misconceptions.

lesson_flow.description: Students complete a worksheet on noun genders and declensions.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Circulate to offer help and check for understanding.

lesson_flow.description: Recap the day's lesson and preview the next topic.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in a brief Q&A session.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Highlight the importance of noun declensions in forming sentences.

behavior.loop_behavior: Rephrase and repeat key concepts as needed
